lines.text: Particles vibrate <u>perpendicularly</u> to direction of wave
Particles vibrate <u>parallel</u> to direction of wave

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we describe the motion of a particle in a wave?

Enduring Understandings:
1. In transverse waves, particles in the medium move perpendicular to the motion of the wave. In longitudinal waves, particles in the medium move parallel to the motion of the wave. In surface waves, particles in the medium move both parallel and perpendicular to the motion of the wave.
2. Position graphs of the motion of a particle in a wave are identical to graphs of simple harmonic motion.
Vocabulary: transverse wave, longitudinal wave, surface waves
